content.description: The hand crack on Triple Cracks.    Climb up using jams and stemming where necessary. In the end we really just stemmed the chimney  and used the crack for pro. If you tried it with ought stemming this would easily be a hard 5.10.
content.protection: Camalots from .4-2  and maybe some tricams or nuts. But you don't need much more than that unless you really want to really sew it up.
content.location: Hand crack in the Triple cracks chimney. Use the tree on top (about 5ft back from the edge) to bring up your second or set up a top rope.

content.description: Three cracks in a chimney behind a detached block on the cliff band to the left of Sorenson. This is a great place to climb if it is windy or blazingly hot.    The rock quality is excellent for the canyon since the climbs are always in the shade and don't get much UV damage.    A big tree 4ft from the top makes this probably the easiest top rope set up in the canyon.
